title: How to Remove Permanent Marker from a Whiteboard

steps.title: Dry erase markers act as a solvent for permanent marker ink.
steps.content: Dry erase markers act as a solvent for permanent marker ink. Take a dark dry erase marker and scribble over the Sharpie on your whiteboard. Be sure to cover the entire mark with the dry erase marker. Before the marker has a chance to dry, wipe your whiteboard with an eraser or a soft microfiber towel to lift the mark.

steps.title: Rubbing alcohol dissolves permanent marker off of a dry erase board.
steps.content: Rubbing alcohol dissolves permanent marker off of a dry erase board. Fill a spray bottle or wet the corner of a microfiber cloth with 70% isopropyl alcohol. Wet the mark on your whiteboard and gently wipe it with a soft non-abrasive cloth until you lift the stain. [1] X Research source You can also use pre-packaged alcohol wipes to get Sharpie off a whiteboard.

steps.title: Sanitizer made with alcohol breaks down marker ink.
steps.content: Sanitizer made with alcohol breaks down marker ink. Apply a pump of hand sanitizer onto a clean microfiber cloth and work it into the marks on your dry erase board. Wipe the residue off with a clean section of the cloth so you don’t leave any smudges. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Glass cleaner contains alcohol that works to treat stubborn marks.
steps.content: Glass cleaner contains alcohol that works to treat stubborn marks. Any commercial glass cleaner like Windex will get permanent marker off your whiteboard. Just spray the glass cleaner directly onto your whiteboard and let it sit for a few seconds. Then wipe the mark with a soft microfiber cloth or paper towel to completely clean the board. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Acetone works as a solvent to remove stubborn marks on your whiteboard.
steps.content: Acetone works as a solvent to remove stubborn marks on your whiteboard. Wet the corner of a clean microfiber cloth with your nail polish remover and gently rub the permanent marker in small circles. After you completely lift the mark, wipe the surface with a damp cloth and dry it off to get rid of any excess acetone. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Hairspray dissolves the ink so it’s easier to wipe off.
steps.content: Hairspray dissolves the ink so it’s easier to wipe off. Spray a thin layer of hairspray over the entire permanent marker mark so and leave it to soak in for a few seconds. Take a clean microfiber cloth or paper towel to wipe the hairspray and Sharpie off of the dry erase board. [5] X Research source If the whiteboard feels sticky from the hairspray, wipe it with a damp rag.

steps.title: Toothpaste gently scrubs the marks off of the surface.
steps.content: Toothpaste gently scrubs the marks off of the surface. Put a pea-sized amount of toothpaste on the corner of a soft microfiber cloth and wet it. Gently work the toothpaste into the surface of the whiteboard over the permanent marker. Keep scrubbing until the mark lifts up completely. Then, rinse the area with a damp cloth to remove any residue. [6] X Research source Lightly scrub at the marker residue, but don't press down hard since you could damage the coating on the whiteboard. [7] X Expert Source Eduardo Peralta House Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 29 October 2021.

steps.title: Vinegar breaks down light marker stains from the whiteboard.
steps.content: Vinegar breaks down light marker stains from the whiteboard. You can use the white distilled vinegar you have in your kitchen to clean in a pinch. Wet the corner of a microfiber cloth with the vinegar and gently wipe the permanent marker. Just put in a little elbow grease to lighten the marks on your whiteboard. [8] X Research source

steps.title: A gentle scrub with a Magic Eraser removes really stubborn marks.
steps.content: A gentle scrub with a Magic Eraser removes really stubborn marks. Wet the Magic Eraser so it’s easier to work with. Gently scrub the permanent marker with the non-abrasive side of the Magic Eraser so you don’t damage the whiteboard. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Cream like Ben-Gay has alcohol that lifts marker from the whiteboard's surface.
steps.content: Cream like Ben-Gay has alcohol that lifts marker from the whiteboard's surface. You can buy muscle ache cream from your local pharmacy. Take a pea-sized amount of the cream on a microfiber cloth and gently wipe it over the permanent marker. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Specialty cleaners are specifically made to break down marker residue.
steps.content: Specialty cleaners are specifically made to break down marker residue. You can buy the cleaner from an office supply store or online. Spray the cleaner directly onto the stain and let it sit for a few seconds before wiping it off with a microfiber cloth or paper towel. [11] X Expert Source Eduardo Peralta House Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 29 October 2021.
